definition: a tiny bit/a wee bit
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
surname Ding

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: And you are worth only a little more than they.
sentences.chinese: 而且也只能比馬和牛多那麼一丁點價值。

sentences.english: I don’t say all this just to talk about a blip in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我不要說這一切只是談論一丁點兒在我的生命中。

sentences.english: I thank strangers who’ve shown me little acts of kindness.
sentences.chinese: 我感謝陌生人，哪怕他們只對我表示一丁點友好。

sentences.english: Even though I haven't written a lick of code yet, it's time to write a test.
sentences.chinese: 即使我還沒有編寫一丁點代碼，但也該編寫測試了。

sentences.english: But they sent them to me and Inever had to have an eighth of an inch changed.
sentences.chinese: 不過他們把衣服送來後，我沒感覺有一丁點兒不稱身。

sentences.english: You almost never catch a whiff of authorial self-consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 你幾乎不能捕捉到一丁點兒作者的自我意識。

sentences.english: This made me a tiny bit uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 這句話讓我有一丁點兒不舒服。

sentences.english: This sushi bar is just a hole-in-the-wall, but it's quite famous in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 這家壽司店只有一丁點大，但是在東京相當有名。

sentences.english: Art is impossible without at least a degree of stability.
sentences.chinese: 缺少一丁點的穩定，對藝術來說都是不可能。

sentences.english: There is not a scintilla of evidence in this case.
sentences.chinese: 在這個個案裏，連一丁點證據也沒有。

sentences.english: A Pin a Day is a Grout a Year.
sentences.chinese: 每天節約一丁點兒一年就是一大筆。

sentences.english: Did America care one hoot for Africa's best interest?
sentences.chinese: 美國有沒有想到過非洲一丁點的最佳利益？

sentences.english: Hydra are beautiful, but a wee bit annoying creatures.
sentences.chinese: 水螅是美麗的，但一丁點煩人的生物。

sentences.english: Do they have any combat proficiency?
sentences.chinese: 他們擁有一丁點兒熟練的戰鬥技能嗎？

sentences.english: If the lake with a sound, they will dive into the water.
sentences.chinese: 如果湖邊有了一丁點兒響動，它們會馬上潛入水中。

sentences.english: There is still a tiny bit of lag when panning but it's much improved.
sentences.chinese: 搖鏡頭還是有一丁點卡但是已經提高了很多。

definition: actually/in fact/really
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
it doesn't matter
face
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
embarrassed
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
willingly
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
not to have any meaning/meaningless
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
